title.narrative: OP 3. WASH IN SCHOOLS AND COMMUNITIES

description.narrative: Focus Provinces/ Districts have increased capacity and deliver child friendly, gender-sensitive WASH services in schools and communities including Primary Health Institutions

sector.narrative: Sanitation - eliminating open defecation in peri-urban and urban communities
Sanitation - improving services in rural communities (except household water treatment and storage, moving up the ladder and strengthening sustainability)
Sanitation and hygiene - eliminating open defecation in rural communities
Sanitation and hygiene - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) including menstrual hygiene management
Water supply - rural communities service delivery
Water supply - safety/quality/treatment (including household treatment and safe storage)

description.narrative: Water supply and Sanitation policy, planning and administration
Water supply and Sanitation rural sanitation

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Focus Provinces/ Districts have increased capacity and deliver child friendly, gender-sensitive WASH services in schools and communities including Primary Health Institutions

description.narrative: 2 entire districts in Borikhamxay Province declared ODF. 5452 primary school children including 2718 girls in 51 primary schools received hygiene education and practiced daily routine behaviours. 10,318 children including 5145 girls in 102 primary schools have access to and use of gender sensitive latrines equipped with handwashing stations. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:15/01/2017

title.narrative: # of people in target communities that are reached with hygiene promotion interventions
# of population in select rural communities have access to and use of improved source of water
# of population in select communities have access to and use of basic sanitation facilities

actual.value: 2016:97 communities declared ODF in 2016 Approximately 83,500 people in 2 provinces live in ODF environment including the 2 entire districts declared ODF.

title.narrative: (NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) ) Additional number of people with access to sanitation in the reporting year only, as a result of UNICEF direct support
# of schools in select Provinces provided with WASH facilities that meet the national standards

actual.value:
2016: Cumulative target met at 688.
102 schools were provided with WASH facilities in 2016

title.narrative: (NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) ) additional number of people with access to an improved drinking water source in the reporting year only, as a result of UNICEF direct support
